required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Cervical Ripening in the Outpatient Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Cervical Ripening in the Outpatient Setting Using Mifepristone Versus Balloon Catheter: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized controlled trial of mifepristone 200mg vs balloon catheter for cervical ripening.

detailed_description.textblock:
Artificial induction of labour is currently required in 25-30% of all pregnancies, in high-resource countries. While the pharmacological modifications to the collagen matrix of the cervix, that allow it to dilate (cervical ripening) occur spontaneously in many women, allowing labour to be induced with oxytocin, in others the process needs to be triggered artificially. Cervical ripening is traditionally accomplished with prostaglandins or mechanical agents, in processes that typically require 12-24 hours of hospital stay. More recently, a limited number of hospitals have shifted towards starting the process in house, but then allowing women to return home and be re-evaluated on the following day.
The main aims this study is to compare efficacy and patient satisfaction of mifepristone vs balloon catheter for cervical ripening.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Bishop score ≥6
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients (%) with Bishop score ≥6 24 hours after intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean of gain in Bishop score
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of gain in Bishop score from intervention to hospital admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in active phase of labour (≥4 cm dilatation + ≥ 80% effacement and regular contractions) without need of further medication
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients (%) in active phase of labour (≥4 cm dilatation + ≥ 80% effacement and regular contractions) without need of further medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Time frame between intervention and active phase of labour
secondary_outcome.description: Time frame between intervention and active phase of labour (min)
Delivery time frame in mins from intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with vaginal delivery within 24hrs
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of vaginal deliveries within 24 hours since admission to hospital (%)
Rate of vaginal deliveries within 48 hours since admission to hospital (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacological agents for labor induction (Prostaglandins, Oxytocin)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of women that required pharmacological cervical ripening agents (%) requirement (%)
Proportion of patients that delivered vaginal by forceps assistance or vacuum (%) assistance.
Proportion of patients that delivered by cesarean (%).
Rate of women who require any analgesia during cervical ripening process (%)
Rate of women who had vaginal bleeding during cervical ripening process (%)
Rate of women who had reduced fetal movements during cervical ripening process (%)
Rate of women who had non reassuring fetal status(CTG) during cervical ripening process (%)
Patient satisfaction associated with intervention used for cervical ripening from patient questionnaire

other_outcome.description: Rate of newborns admitted in Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (%)
Rate of women with postpartum haemorrhage (%)
Rate of newborns with 5 minute apgar score <7 (%)
Rate of metabolic acidosis (pH< 7.00 e BD > 12 mmol/l) (%)

clinical_study.condition: Labor; Forced or Induced, Affecting Fetus or Newborn

arm_group.description: Balloon catheter with 40ml placed 24hours before the induction day

intervention.description: Subjects will undergo cervical ripening in the outpatient setting. The patients will then be scheduled to return the next morning for induction of labor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman scheduled for induction of labor.
- Age between 18 and 45 years.
- Understanding and capable to sign informed consent.
- Singleton pregnancy.
- Gestational age ≥ 37 0/7 weeks.
- Live fetus in cephalic presentation.
- Intact membranes
- Bishop score < 6
- Estimated fetal weight < 4500g
- Without contraindication to vaginal delivery
- No major fetal anomaly
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous cesarean section or myomectomy
- Hypertension
- Diabetes
- Thyroid disease
- Maternal conditions with high risk of placental insufficiency
